intro: Doratometra, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Southern Hemisphere, particularly in South America and Australia. These plants typically grow in rocky or forested areas, often at high altitudes. Doratometra species are characterized by their evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. They play an important role in their ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
